title: Chupoclops
data:
**Chupoclops the Hope-trapper** is a [spirit](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\) "Spirits (dNetHack)") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Ritual, seal and taboo](#Ritual.2C_seal_and_taboo)

- [2 Mark](#Mark)

- [3 Benefits](#Benefits)

- [4 As a monster](#As_a_monster)

  - [4.1 Generation](#Generation)
  - [4.2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Ritual, seal and taboo

Chupoclops requires that her seal be drawn around a [grave](/wiki/Grave "Grave") or a [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") of the same race as your character.

To keep Chupoclops bound, you must not engrave [wards](/wiki/Ward_\(dNetHack\) "Ward (dNetHack)").

## Mark

You grow a pair of chelicerae in your mouth. The chelicerae cannot be seen from a distance, and may by hidden up close by wearing a [mask](/wiki/Mask_\(dNetHack\) "Mask (dNetHack)") to hide your mouth.

## Benefits

You gain [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance") and cannot be trapped by [webs](/wiki/Web "Web"), and obtain [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill") in [knives](/wiki/Knives "Knives").

Chupoclops's active powers are as follows:

- **Throw Webbing**: Throw a ball of webbing in a chosen direction.

Chupoclops's passive powers are as follows:

- **Poisonous Bite**: You gain a 2d4 [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") bite attack.
- **Grave Eater**: You can eat tainted corpses safely.
- **Aura of Despair**: Monsters within 5 squares of you lose (your level)/10 + 1 movement points.
- **Ethereal Strike**: When attacking, your hits ignore armor and can always hit intangible monsters such as [shades](/wiki/Shade "Shade") and [Sharab Kamerel](/wiki/Sharab_Kamerel "Sharab Kamerel").

## As a monster

| s Chupoclops *(No tile)*                                        |                                                                                                        |
| --------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| **[Difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty")** | 22                                                                                                     |
| **Attacks**                                                     | bite 4d8 poison (STR), kick 3d6 spreads webbing, passive 0d0 spreads webbing, spit 2d4 spreads webbing |
|                                                                 |                                                                                                        |

| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| **[Difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | 22                                                                                                     |
| **Attacks**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | bite 4d8 poison (STR), kick 3d6 spreads webbing, passive 0d0 spreads webbing, spit 2d4 spreads webbing |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |                                                                                                        |

| **[Nutritional value](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   | 800                                                                                                    |
| **[Size](/wiki/Physical_size "Physical size")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | large                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |                                                                                                        |

| **Resistances [conveyed](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | [sleep](/wiki/Sleep "Sleep"), [poison](/wiki/Poison "Poison")                                          |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |                                                                                                        |
| Chupoclops:* has no hands.
* is an [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal").
* can [lay eggs](/wiki/Oviparous "Oviparous").
* is [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") to eat.
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is female.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless").
* cannot be [tamed](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming"). |                                                                                                        |

In notdNetHack, **Chupoclops**, s, also appears as a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that can be summoned by an Illithanachronounbinder. She is a [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong"), [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") and [oviparous](/wiki/Oviparous "Oviparous") [spidery](/wiki/Arachnid_or_centipede "Arachnid or centipede") [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal").

Chupoclops has a strong [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") bite attack, a 'kick' attack that can trap her target in a web, a passive attack that also spreads webbing, and the ability to spit balls of webbing at targets. She possesses [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance") and [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance").

Chupoclops is poisonous to consume, which primarily comes up if she is [digested](/wiki/Digest "Digest") by another monster. Like most summoned spirits, she cannot be [tamed](/wiki/Tame "Tame").

### Generation

Chupoclops is first generated when summoned from her seal by an Illithanachronounbinder. She is always created hostile, and is not a valid form for normal [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph").

Chupoclops is [generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") several [cave spider](/wiki/Cave_spider "Cave spider") [eggs](/wiki/Egg "Egg").

Chupoclops [does not leave a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless") upon death.

### Strategy

**Below this point, there are major spoilers for the Illithanachronounbinder role.** They can be accessed by selecting the "Role spoiler" tab.

[x][ ]

- Strategy
- Role spoiler

On paper, Chupoclops is a quick-moving monster with 16 [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed"), strong attacks and several means of creating immobilizing webs that should be very dangerous to an unwary Illithanachronounbinder. However, performing her binding ritual will confer immunity to being trapped in webs, and can also slow her down as well - while she cannot be trapped in webs herself, the movement speed penalties inflicted by her passive power can slow her down enough to avoid her poisonous bite, which can still be deadly.

The many spider eggs she carries will hatch and spawn an army of cave spiders, which can prove annoying if you have not yet dealt with Chupoclops by that point.

If Chupoclops is killed after being summoned, she can be encountered again in the [Void](/index.php?title=Void\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Void (page does not exist)"), a branch accessed by opening the high [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") of [Ilsensine the Fallen](/wiki/Ilsensine_the_Fallen "Ilsensine the Fallen") as an Illithanachronounbinder using the [invoke](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke") effect of [The Elder Cerebral Fluid](/wiki/The_Elder_Cerebral_Fluid "The Elder Cerebral Fluid"). Chupoclops is generated along with many other spirits of the near void on the first floor of the branch, and is created with the "whispers" template, which makes her [nonliving](/wiki/Nonliving "Nonliving").

## Encyclopedia entry

“The Eldar knew not whence she came; but some have said that in ages long before she descended from the darkness that lies about Arda, when Melkor first looked down in envy upon the Kingdom of Manwë, and that in the beginning she was one of those that he corrupted to his service. But she had disowned her Master, desiring to be mistress of her own lust, taking all things to herself to feed her emptiness”  
  
\[ The Silmarillion, Of the Darkening of Valinor ]  
  
“Of the fate of Ungoliant no tale tells. Yet some have said that she ended long ago, when in her uttermost famine she devoured herself at last.”  
  
\[ The Silmarillion, Of the Flight of the Noldor ]

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Chupoclops

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Chupoclops the Hope-trapper is a spirit that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack.

Contents

  • 1 Ritual, seal and taboo
  • 2 Mark
  • 3 Benefits
  • 4 As a monster
    • 4.1 Generation
    • 4.2 Strategy
  • 5 Encyclopedia entry

Ritual, seal and taboo

Chupoclops requires that her seal be drawn around a grave or a corpse of the same race as your character.

To keep Chupoclops bound, you must not engrave wards.

Mark

You grow a pair of chelicerae in your mouth. The chelicerae cannot be seen from a distance, and may by hidden up close by wearing a mask to hide your mouth.

Benefits

You gain sleep resistance and cannot be trapped by webs, and obtain skill in knives.

Chupoclops's active powers are as follows:

  • Throw Webbing: Throw a ball of webbing in a chosen direction.

Chupoclops's passive powers are as follows:

  • Poisonous Bite: You gain a 2d4 poisonous bite attack.
  • Grave Eater: You can eat tainted corpses safely.
  • Aura of Despair: Monsters within 5 squares of you lose (your level)/10 + 1 movement points.
  • Ethereal Strike: When attacking, your hits ignore armor and can always hit intangible monsters such as shades and Sharab Kamerel.

As a monster

s Chupoclops (No tile)
Difficulty 22
Attacks bite 4d8 poison (STR), kick 3d6 spreads webbing, passive 0d0 spreads webbing, spit 2d4 spreads webbing
s Chupoclops (No tile)
Difficulty 22
Attacks

bite 4d8 poison (STR), kick 3d6 spreads webbing, passive 0d0 spreads webbing, spit 2d4 spreads webbing

Base level 17
Base experience 550
Speed 16
Base AC 4
Base MR 50
Alignment -5 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 3000
Nutritional value 800
Size large
Resistances sleep, poison
Resistances conveyed sleep, poison

Chupoclops:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • can lay eggs.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is strong.
  • never leaves a corpse.
  • cannot be tamed.

In notdNetHack, Chupoclops, s, also appears as a monster that can be summoned by an Illithanachronounbinder. She is a strong, carnivorous and oviparous spidery animal.

Chupoclops has a strong poisonous bite attack, a 'kick' attack that can trap her target in a web, a passive attack that also spreads webbing, and the ability to spit balls of webbing at targets. She possesses sleep resistance and poison resistance.

Chupoclops is poisonous to consume, which primarily comes up if she is digested by another monster. Like most summoned spirits, she cannot be tamed.

Generation

Chupoclops is first generated when summoned from her seal by an Illithanachronounbinder. She is always created hostile, and is not a valid form for normal polymorph.

Chupoclops is generated with several cave spider eggs.

Chupoclops does not leave a corpse upon death.

Strategy

Below this point, there are major spoilers for the Illithanachronounbinder role. They can be accessed by selecting the "Role spoiler" tab.

On paper, Chupoclops is a quick-moving monster with 16 speed, strong attacks and several means of creating immobilizing webs that should be very dangerous to an unwary Illithanachronounbinder. However, performing her binding ritual will confer immunity to being trapped in webs, and can also slow her down as well - while she cannot be trapped in webs herself, the movement speed penalties inflicted by her passive power can slow her down enough to avoid her poisonous bite, which can still be deadly.

The many spider eggs she carries will hatch and spawn an army of cave spiders, which can prove annoying if you have not yet dealt with Chupoclops by that point.

If Chupoclops is killed after being summoned, she can be encountered again in the Void, a branch accessed by opening the high altar of Ilsensine the Fallen as an Illithanachronounbinder using the invoke effect of The Elder Cerebral Fluid. Chupoclops is generated along with many other spirits of the near void on the first floor of the branch, and is created with the "whispers" template, which makes her nonliving.

Encyclopedia entry

“The Eldar knew not whence she came; but some have said that in ages long before she descended from the darkness that lies about Arda, when Melkor first looked down in envy upon the Kingdom of Manwë, and that in the beginning she was one of those that he corrupted to his service. But she had disowned her Master, desiring to be mistress of her own lust, taking all things to herself to feed her emptiness”

[ The Silmarillion, Of the Darkening of Valinor ]

“Of the fate of Ungoliant no tale tells. Yet some have said that she ended long ago, when in her uttermost famine she devoured herself at last.”

[ The Silmarillion, Of the Flight of the Noldor ]

Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Chupoclops&oldid=167740"

'''Chupoclops the Hope-trapper''' is a [[Spirits (dNetHack)|spirit]] that appears in [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]].

==Ritual, seal and taboo==
Chupoclops requires that her seal be drawn around a [[grave]] or a [[corpse]] of the same race as your character.

To keep Chupoclops bound, you must not engrave [[Ward (dNetHack)|wards]].

==Mark==
You grow a pair of chelicerae in your mouth. The chelicerae cannot be seen from a distance, and may by hidden up close by wearing a [[Mask (dNetHack)|mask]] to hide your mouth.

==Benefits==
You gain [[sleep resistance]] and cannot be trapped by [[web]]s, and obtain [[skill]] in [[knives]].

Chupoclops's active powers are as follows:

* '''Throw Webbing''': Throw a ball of webbing in a chosen direction.

Chupoclops's passive powers are as follows:

* '''Poisonous Bite''': You gain a 2d4 [[poisonous]] bite attack.
* '''Grave Eater''': You can eat tainted corpses safely.
* '''Aura of Despair''': Monsters within 5 squares of you lose (your level)/10 + 1 movement points.
* '''Ethereal Strike''': When attacking, your hits ignore armor and can always hit intangible monsters such as [[shade]]s and [[Sharab Kamerel]].

In notdNetHack, '''Chupoclops''', {{black|s}}, also appears as a [[monster]] that can be summoned by an Illithanachronounbinder. She is a [[strong]], [[carnivorous]] and [[oviparous]] [[arachnid or centipede|spidery]] [[animal]].

Chupoclops has a strong [[poisonous]] bite attack, a 'kick' attack that can trap her target in a web, a passive attack that also spreads webbing, and the ability to spit balls of webbing at targets. She possesses [[sleep resistance]] and [[poison resistance]].

Chupoclops is poisonous to consume, which primarily comes up if she is [[digest]]ed by another monster. Like most summoned spirits, she cannot be [[tame]]d.

===Generation===
Chupoclops is first generated when summoned from her seal by an Illithanachronounbinder. She is always created hostile, and is not a valid form for normal [[polymorph]].

Chupoclops is [[Monster starting inventory|generated with]] several [[cave spider]] [[egg]]s.

Chupoclops [[Corpseless|does not leave a corpse]] upon death.

===Strategy===

However, performing her binding ritual will confer immunity to being trapped in webs, and can also slow her down as well - while she cannot be trapped in webs herself, the movement speed penalties inflicted by her passive power can slow her down enough to avoid her poisonous bite, which can still be deadly.

The many spider eggs she carries will hatch and spawn an army of cave spiders, which can prove annoying if you have not yet dealt with Chupoclops by that point.

Chupoclops is generated along with many other spirits of the near void on the first floor of the branch, and is created with the "whispers" template, which makes her [[nonliving]].

But she had disowned her Master, desiring to be mistress of her own lust, taking all things to herself to feed her emptiness”
